Action: ## User notification search
Setup: Carry out a number of activities which generate notifications visible to your user account OR
Setup: Ask the development team to run the make_notifications script for your user account to generate a selection of realistic notifications for you

Go to the Managing Editor's dashboard

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//dashboard
Click on the Notification menu item on the top bar

Expected Test Results: You are taken to the notification search page
You can see the first page of your notifications, most recent notification first

Action: find a notification which is unseen (the icon on the right contains a solid black circle) and which has no action associated with it (it will say "Mark as seen" on the right)
Click "Mark as seen"

Expected Test Results: The black circle on the right becomes an empty circle
The link "Mark as seen" disappears

Action: find a notification which is unseen and requires action
Click "see action"

Expected Test Results: A new tab/window opens
You are taken to an appropriate action page for the notification

Action: Go back to the search interface

Expected Test Results: the notification you clicked on above is no longer marked as unseen (the black circle has become an empty circle)

Action: Hover your mouse over the "seen notification" icon (the empty circle).

Expected Test Results: a tooltip appears which tells you the date the notification was marked as seen

Action: Hover your mouse over the resut type icon (next to/below the "seen notification" icon)

Expected Test Results: a tooltip appears which tells you the nature of the notification

Action: Enter some search text in the search box and press enter

Expected Test Results: your search results are limited to those containing the text in the search box
They are still ordered by date, most recent first

Action: Clear the search filter by removing the text and pressing enter

Expected Test Results: your original unfiltered list of notifications is restored

Action: Try the other search controls, such as changing the page size and navigation to the next/previous page

Expected Test Results: search behaviours act as expected
